text: WHAM, the first shot of the movie assaults us in the form a man EXPLODING into frame -- powerful, dangerous, the ki of cat who can kill you with a hard look. But now he’s scared, running as if hell itself was behind him. Around him a nameless city towers like a concrete jungle. With the fugitive, moving, handheld, frenetic, jarring, echoing his state of mind. PREDATOR POV: The prey in infrared, seen from above. The man glances back, sees nothing -- redoubles his alrea punishing pace. Turns the corner -- left or right, split second to decide he goes left -- powers along the street, arms pumping lik pistons, shoes SLAPPING the shit out of the pavement, a staccato rhythm -- trips, falls -- staggers back on his f using a chainlink fence for purchase.

head_text.subj: SOMETHING LUNGES AT HIM FROM THE SHADOWS ON THE OTHER SID

text: A leashed pitbull -- its jaws SNAP a few inches away from guy’s face. He reels, gun up -- the hound SNARLS, trying to get at th intruder -- but whatever is chasing him is much worse -- recovers, rushes away, an adrenaline-powered juggernaut, dog’s BARK chasing him like a stream of obscenities. Alley, alley, dead end, shit! He spins, scanning for exit there are none, double shit, about to backtrack--  In the distance the dog abruptly SHUTS UP. He freezes. Back against the wall. Pistol pointed at the mouth of the alley, held in a shaky grip. The look of a m about to face a six foot spider with a toothpick Street light BUZZES, flickering in and out of existence. unsettling strobing effect. The man waits, sucking air, finger on the trigger... wait waits... Nothing. He relaxes just a bit. WHAM, he’s JERKED upward as if plucked by an invisible ha Make it a noose. He dangles from it, losing the gun in th process, tips of his toes scraping the ground. A liquid brown and viscous, SPLASHES from above, drenching him. He chokes. FOOTSTEPS. The hunter approaches. We fully exp to see Predator... Guess again. Or rather it is a predator of a different ki Call him ROYCE. A Steve McQueen face, hard but not unhandsome. Barely broke a sweat. Takes off Raptor infrar goggles. The man stares at him, eyes wide with terror. GURGLING. M trying to form words that never come. It doesn’t matter. Royce’s heard it all before. The voice from the opening shot:

This is not how I would do it. But it’s how they wanted it done. He lights a match against his finger. Tosses it into the spreading puddle. Walks away without looking back. WHOOSH! The man lights up like a bonfire. SCREAMS as he b alive. Royce keeps walking.

An electric wind SWEEPS along the street. POP, POP, POP, lights BLOW out in quick succession. Royce spins, sensing something coming up from behind a sp second before-- IMPACT. SMASH TO BLACK. Blood red letters.
An ocean of white. A body PLUMMETS toward it, almost peaceful, a fallen angel... TEARS through the clouds.
Eyes snap open, disoriented, panicked. Mind behind them races, coming back online, trying to regain its bearings. Discovering that he is--

That’s right. He’s plummeting through the void at 160 mph earthbound missile dressed in the same clothes he wore a moment ago, twisting, tumbling, SCREAMING, wind HOWLING, whipping mercilessly at his hair and flesh. Just like the nightmare we’ve all had. Except this. IS. FUCKING. HAPPENING. Reality is a washer/dryer in a spin cycle. With each rota we catch a glimpse of blue above, a vast expanse of green below, the latter closing fast. An altimeter of foreign design is hooked to a harness crossing Royce’s chest. LED flashes in a degrading sequence... a countdown... and then the thing cracks! Parachute deploys with a POP. Much like the altimeter tha triggered its release, its design is unfamiliar to us. Royce goes from terminal velocity to 30 in less than a second, deceleration jerking him up. Jungle looms. IMPACT

Royce CRASHES through the double canopy at a 45 degree an BASHING against trunks, CLIPPING branches, before finally Hitting the ground. HARD. Beat. Royce climbs to his feet. Tries to steady his ragge breathing. Uncouples the chute’s harness with shaky finge Takes in his surroundings. He’s in a small clearing framed by monstrous tropical tre plants and bushes, obscuring vision in all directions. Sh of light stream from openings in the foliage a hundred fe above. The steady BUZZ of insects, punctuated by occasion CRIES of birds and monkeys, breaks the eerie silence. It’s haunting. Humid. And hot as hell. Royce stares in a state of shock. One question:
What the fuck? CRASH! A chute-laden figure duplicates Royce’s descent.

(in Spanish) Fuck! FUCK! FUCCCCCCCCCCKKKKKK! ! ! ! Royce watches. All he can do is watch. The man lands a few feet away. Twin Uzis are strapped to back. An intricate webwork of scars and tattoos covers hi torso. His age unplacable. His real name immaterial. But places like Juarez and Tijuana he’s known as--
(Spanish) Who the hell are you?! CRASH! A body SMASHES on the ground like a cannon ball, stealing their attention. This one won’t be getting up.
(Spanish) Who the hell is he?! POP, the dead man’s chute unfurls. Too little too late.
The guy whose chute didn’t work. He hears muted voices. Moves, confusion pushing up agains something harder on the inside.
(switches to English) Hey! Hey! Where the fuck are you going? Hey!!! He tries to follow, gets tangled in the chute lines. They jerk him back. Curses some more. We leave him to it.
With Royce, slicing through thick vegetation toward voice panicked, SHOUTING in languages we don’t understand.

Parachutes strewn about. NIKOLAI, a frightening bear of a in VDV fatigues with no identity badges or insignias, arm with GShG-7.62 -- a four barreled gas powered rotary mach gun, its barrel still smoking -- is yelling in Russian at ISABELLE, jeans and button down shirt, pretty if she ever bothered to smile, her own Heckler & Koch PSG1 sniper rif pointed at the big man, as she yells back in French. What we have here is a failure to communicate. Heads and weapons turn to Royce, as he appears. Both yell him for a change. He raises his hands, indicating intention rather than surrender.

Easy. Branches CRACK. Leaves rain down. All spin toward the sou Fifteen feet above STANS -- shaved head, scorpion tattoo his neck, orange jumpsuit with the faded words “San Quent stenciled into the fabric -- is cutting through the lines his chute with a prison shiv.  Drops. Lands on his feet like a cat. Backs away from the others, feral, stabbing at the air.

I’m gonna cut you! I’m gonna fucking cut you! And stops, hand wrapped around his mouth, blade pressed firmly against his carotid artery. Their owner, MOMBASA, materializes behind Stans with the silent swiftness of a ghost. Black. Early 20’s. But in th part of the world he comes from, he’s considered old.

(African accent; cold) Put down your weapons. Or he dies. The confused group take one another in with weary eyes. Paranoia. Panic. A hairline away from a trigger pull. Nikolai is about to say something. Royce motions for him keep quiet. Royce doesn’t talk. He listens. And then he’s moving again. Cuchillo emerges out of the bushes. Surveys the new arriv
Can someone fucking tell me what the fuck is going on?
(keying on the same thing Royce did) Water. She starts after Royce.

I said I’m going to cut his throat. Nikolai ignores him, follows. Cuchillo is not far behind. Mombasa looks after. Realizes the futility of his threat. Shoves Stans aside. Mombasa. Stans. Looks exchanged. The kind that promise “ isn’t over”. Mombasa strides off in the same direction. Stans backstab him with a glare. Weighs his options. Trails after. We linger on the now empty clearing. A figure steps out of the bushes. Has been there the enti time. Name’s HANZO. Japanese, slender, dark suit, white shirt, Beretta 92FS in a worn shoulder holster. Look clos and you’1l see he’s missing two finger tips on his left h Considers. Walks after the others. SQUISH, his dress shoes sink into mud. Hanzo -- utterly undeterred -- takes them off. Then the socks. Lays down the items neatly on the ground. Resumes journey. We stay on the shoes.

Royce pushes through the foliage. Stops. A shallow creek runs in front of him. To the right, sitti on a rock, his back toward Royce, is a small unassuming m Caucasian, glasses, beige slacks, white T. This is EDWIN. He stares at the water with the wonder and innocence of a child. Turns, taking in Royce and the others. A trickle of blood travels slowly along the side of his f
This is not where I was before.
You’re bleeding. Edwin’s fingers come away red and wet. He studies them absentmindedly.
Oh that. It’s not mine.  “Creepy” doesn’t even begin to scratch the surface. Royce takes the reigns. To all:
Last thing you remember?
War. Mombasa nods. Same here.
I was... working. And then everything just...
Stopped. We pan across their faces.
...What the hell happened to us? On Stans. A thought forming. Doesn’t happen often.
Waaait. You don’t mean... we could be... dead? That gives everyone pause. Obviously a possibility they haven’t considered. Stans begins to freak out
Holy shit! I’m dead, aren’t I?! I’m dead, and this is hell!
Last I checked, you didn’t need a parachute to get there. Good point. Still,
Why put us here?
How do I even know “here” exists? Maybe I’m lying in a hospital, ina coma. And this, all this, is just some bad dream.
(with conviction) I’m real. That fall was real. (clutching his AK-47) This is real.
Maybe we pissed off the wrong people. Maybe this is punishment.
Where I come from, you piss someone off, they stick a shiv in your back. Not dump you in the middle of a jungle.

A test then. See how we do under pressure. That’s why they armed us. Royce’s attention is elsewhere. A leaf in his hand. Water in it. A small sliver of metal floats on a smaller leaf. A makeshift compass. The metal-bearing leaf spins madly, refusing to settle.
Some kind of psychotropic compound. Hanzo drifts out of the bushes. Sidelines. A silent nod. They take him in. That dreaded question again:
What _the hell happened to us? On Royce. He’s heard enough.
It doesn’t matter. It happened. They look toward him, eager for solutions, for answers, f something, anything, to make sense again. Brass tacks:  10.
water means life. There might be a camp or a village down stream. They move down the creek. Together. For the moment.

Sun beats down without mercy. The stream -- wider now -- to the left, as Royce, on point, hacks a path through lus vegetation with even, surgeon-like strokes. The rest of the crew is spread out behind him. All around them a jungle labyrinth, towering and vast SOUNDS, shadows, the sense of something just outside of o field of vision. Something dangerous. Stans keeps glancing up, hunched over, uncomfortable, as feeling the weight of the open space on his shoulders.
(to Royce) So where’s this village? No response.
Hey! I’m talking to you! Where’s the fucking village? Royce waves toward the jungle.
That way. Twenty klicks. You should start now. Stans bristles, stalks away.
What’s up with him?
Freedom. Off Nikolai’s puzzled look, speaking from experience:  11.

Take a monkey out of the cage it’1l miss the bars. Close on a blooming plant. Others pass it. Isabelle pause for a look, taken by its structure. Its pedals are bright, delicate, almost hypnotic in their appearance. She reaches out to touch them... Edwin’s hand intercepts hers.
I wouldn’t do that. She recoils from his touch. Edwin smiles, used to the effect. Flicks out a surgical scalpel. Gingerly extends it toward-- SNAP, the pedals close around the blade like a bear trap.
(a hint of admiration) Archaefructus liaoningensis. Very poisonous. He withdraws the scalpel. Yellow pus drips off the steel.
Very deadly. All it would take is one scratch. A Clarification:
I read a lot. (beat) Strange though.
How’s that?
They have been extinct since the early Cretaceous period. 125 million years ago. Another mystery. They shake it off. Keep walking.  12.
It becomes a river. They follow its course.
From high above our guys look like ants crawling along a blue thread. Nothing but jungle in all directions.
Royce appears in the distance, heading toward us. Suddenl stops, eyes on the ground. Isabelle notes his concern.
What is it?
Tracks. Faint outlines you and I would miss. Royce kneels by them
So?
So I’ve never seen them before. He touches the ground, trying to determine what creature could have made them. Almost to himself:
...Fresh.
What are you? Some kind of hunter?
Some kind.
Like lions, tigers and shit? Royce rises. Looks him square in the eye.

No. Like you.  13. He resumes the trek. Hanzo is last. Leans over the current. Splashes some H20 his face. HIS POV, obscured by the dripping water: Jungle across th river. Something moves. Quick. Like a spectre. And then i gone. Hanzo stares. Off his expression

Light’s dimmer now. Sounds seem louder and closer. And mo malevolent. Aching muscles. Sweat stains. The journey is taking its t and it shows. The crew is taking a brief respite. Cuchillo eyes the muddy stream.
Think it’s safe to drink?

You find out. You let me know. Mombasa pulls down a thick vine. THWACK, severs it with h knife. A trickle of water emerges. He drinks. Beat. They rush to follow his example, guzzle greedily. Stans watches Isabelle. The predatory gleam in his gaze promises nothing but trouble. She feels his eyes on her. Turns. Stans grins. She doesn’t. If looks could kill, Stans would be a dead m Gradually Stans’s smirk curdles like milk. He looks away. Isabelle settles down next to Royce. PUSH IN on them, forsaking the others.
You got a name?  14. Royce looks at her for a beat.
...Royce.
Isabelle. So. What do you think? He shrugs. In his POV, panning over the faces of their companions, reading them like a coloring book

Spetsnaz, Alpha Group. Los Zeta, cartel enforcer. RUF, Sierra Leone death squad. Yakuza, Inagawa-kai. Former FBI’s Most Wanted. Settling on Edwin, who’s raptly examining a beautiful mon butterfly that’s landed on his arm:
That.
Finally returning to Isabelle. A nod toward the sniper ri
And you. (beat) I’d say we were chosen. Silence. It hangs there. Like a noose.
Chosen for what?

Sonic boom CRASHES over the clearing like a tsunami. Something large streaks overhead, too fast to make out. Earth SHAKES. Bushes compress. Our crew is knocked down, over teacups. And then it’s gone, just as suddenly as it appeared, a pa of destruction visible through the jungle. The tumult fades. They dust themselves off. Shaken but unhurt.  15.
Aircraft?

Had to be military. And that low, it would be landing someplace close. They trade glances. For the first time there’s something in their eyes, shining through grime and exhaustion. Hope No words are exchanged. They move into the jungle, follow the trail. We linger on the now empty campsite. The monarch butterfly writhes in the dirt, trying to take flight. In vain. Its wings have been pulled off.
On the road again. The jungle seems denser, more impenetrable, as if it’s determined to stop our heroes.
View from the trees, looking down as the crew approaches. They descend into a ravine. Slow, treacherous going. Mombasa’s foot snags something. He trips, falls. Stans brushes past. Grins.

Looking good there, boss. A massive tree trunk, suspended by vines, SWINGS toward h like a fist of God! He rolls out of the way, barely. The others scatter, tripping more wires in the process. WHOOSH, WHOOSH, WHOOSH, three makeshift spears spin towar them from as many directions, pincushioning foliage and earth.  16. Cuchillo dodges one, only to trigger the next trap -- a branch, adorned with carved spikes. It LASHES OUT! They duck, the thing passing INCHES above their heads. Isabelle rushes forward, trying to get out of the kill zo Inexplicably PLUNGES straight through the ground-- Into a camouflaged pit. Catches its edge. Hangs there, literally clinging to life by her fingernails. A row of razor sharp Punji sticks await at the bottom. Battling gravity. Losing. Her hold... gives! Royce catches her. Reels her back in. They freeze, eyes and barrels searching for targets. Awai the next attack. Silence. None seems forthcoming. Isabelle raises the rifle, trying to control her breathin HER POV: Scanning... scanning... snapping back toward-- A glint of something.
Three o’clock. 110 yards. Royce is already in motion. Vanishes into the bushes. The rest spread out, follow.
With Royce, moving, fast, soundless, light. He’s at his b now -- alone.
He crests a small ridge. Stops. Stares. We spin around, u Royce as a pivot, revealing the object of his attention.

Desert fatigues, dirty and torn to shreds. Chest cavity l an inward implosion, fused, cauterized, a gaping wound. E open. Staring upward. Into nothingness. The rest of the crew converge, breathing ragged, still ja up on adrenaline. Take in the eerie sight.
We tripped a dead man’s trap.
Two days. Maybe three. Cuchillo crosses himself, a reflex. Nikolai leans over the body. Sizes him up in a glance.
Navy SEAL. Checks his pockets, quick, efficient, a pro. Maps. Foreig currency. Papers. His face registers confusion.
He’s supposed to deployed in Afghanistan.
Just doesn’t make sense. What was he doing setting traps for us?
He wasn’t. He was hunting something else. Something a lot bigger. All eyes on him.
The trunk was a deadfall trap. Rule of thumb, the weight is at least five times heavier than that of the target animal.
So what’s the animal?
No idea. But whatever it was, it came through the trip wires. And did this to him.  18. He points to the SEAL’s decimated chest.
What kind of a weapon does this? This time there’s no answer.
We should bury him.

(cold) Why? He’s dead. He strides away. Nikolai takes off his jacket. Covers the corpse. Soldier soldier. One by one, they trail off. Mombasa is last. Suddenly sto Slowly he turns back. Freezes, staring into the jungle. A sensing something within its depths. Something he can’t name or see. Watching. Waiting... A shimmer in the foreground. Like a heat wave dancing off pavement of a desert highway. A branch sways. Except there’s no wind.
What is it? Mombasa is jerked back to reality. Eyes on Royce, pupils dilated, a man snapping out of a trance.
What did you see?
...Nothing. He moves on. Royce looks after. Then follows.  19.
The crew is on edge, alert, aware of every sound, every s every second. Jungle envelops them from all directions, prehistoric, stark, keeping its secrets. Isabelle sidelines Royce.
Back there. Thank you.
(simple and direct) You’re wrong about me.
How’s that?

You think I’m a decent guy who'll be there for you when push comes to shove. I’m not. And I won’t be. I didn’t save you. I just needed another gun. She nods, accepting the terms. They keep moving. Drift of them to-- Cuchillo clutches a rosary, lips moving in a silent praye
You’re wasting your breath.

We all have to believe in something. Even the worst of us. Perhaps the worst most of all. Motion in the bushes. They react-- SOMETHING takes flight, swoops over their heads, SCREECHE vanishes in the distance. Whew... Stans begins to unravel.
The fuck was that? Looking around, panic building:  20.
I want a gun! Someone give me a fucking gun! No volunteers. Abruptly Stans lunges. Shiv at Mombasa’s throat, drawing blood.
Gun. Now. He might as well be holding a feather duster.
I’m ready to die. Are you? CLICK. That was Mombasa’s 45. Hammer cocked. Pointed at Stans’s heart. A standoff.

An eerie SILENCE descends like a fast falling curtain. Ev the BUZZING and CLICKING of insects have CEASED. They read it. Weapons snap up. Stans and Mombasa disengag Trade glares. Another time. White knuckle tension. Seconds feel like an eternity. They hear it before they see it. A low, growling SOUND. T kind that makes your skin crawl.
A POV of something CRASHING through jungle at speed, SNAP branches like twigs. Deep, heavy panting. Whatever it is it’s fast. Powerful. And lethal.
Royce CLICKS off the safety on his AA-12 shotgun. Isabelle RACKS the bolt of her rifle. Cuchillo PULLS the slides of his Uzis.  21. Nikolai’s chaingun begins to WHIR. They wait. Louder. Closer...
The thing’s POV again. Human forms ahead.

Closer... A blur of motion to the left! A shape -- large, lean, fou legs, leathery skin -- LAUNCHES out of bushes, changing colors, chameleon-like. A cross between a tiger, a boar and your worst nightmare. Royce OPENS UP. Short, accurate bursts. Mombasa UNLEASHES with the AK. Hanzo -- three point stance, steady rate of fire, as if he was at a pistol range. Cuchillo’s Uzis BLA All of the above is muted by the ROAR of Nikolai’s chaing Its barrel spits out a foot of flame. Stream of high velo rounds -- every fifth a tracer -- digs into the creature. It SQUEALS as bullets tear it apart. A geyser of black bl Still, it crawls toward them, barbed tail lashing spastically. Nikolai - fuck me -- keeps firing. Finally the monstrosity halts. Marks its killers with cri eyes, as the light in them dims... and expires. More are coming. Could be three, could be six. Hard to te They are swift, vicious, closing in from three directions Our crew -- fight or flee -- flee it is -- retreat toward only avenue of the escape, laying cover fire, re-painting green with black. Still, they come. Stans’s had enough, breaks, vanishes into the jungle. A thing LUNGES for Isabelle, baring rows of jagged teeth.  22. She tracks it, taking her time... and... BAM! A 30. Magnum hollow point BLOWS its head apart mid-a Black mist. It lands, digging a furrow that ends at her feet.
Run! She moves, pulling Edwin. Another hellhound gives chase. The rest of the crew spread out. Every man for himself.

With Hanzo, running, pushing through thick foliage. Movement ahead. He swings at-- Royce, his own gun lined on Hanzo. Split second relief. Instantly they shift aim, as one of the beasts appears. Both FIRE. CLICK, Royce runs dry. It hears the sound, knows what it means, heads for Royce, even though Hanzo is closer. 10 feet. Royce dumps the gun. 5. He draws a machete. Almost on top of him. Leaps-- Royce drops under its attack, blade held high. The monster sails over him. WHACK, its momentum splits it open from stem to sternum. Black blood drips off cold steel.  23.

Stans sprints, branches SLASHING his face and hands. Way giving a shit. Glances back. Foliage RIPPLES behind him. A shape, closing fast. ITS POV: Stans. Breathing, amplified, distorted. Stans pours everything he’s got left in the tank into a hundred yard dash. Checks his tail again. Nothing there. He has a split second to contemplate his luck before-- WHAM, the thing hits him bodily from the front. They roll, kicking up leaves and dirt. Jaws SNAP. He pushes against the beast’s neck with one ha keeping fangs at bay. Drives the shiv into its side with other. Over and over again. With every stab:

Fuck you! Fuck you! FUCK YOU!!! Black blood spatters his jumpsuit. He SCREAMS, as the creature digs its claws into his shoul ripping flesh. Keeps stabbing. Primal. Brutal. Two animals. The only question, who’ll ki the other first. The thing finally overpowers Stans. Angles for his throat WHAM, a boot SMASHES against its head, forcing it to the ground. Barrel to the ear. BOOM! Silence. The monstrosity twitches, colors shifting, fears even near death. Stans looks up. Mombasa looms over.
Looking good there, boss.  24.
Isabelle slings the rifle, push-pulls Edwin toward a tree

Climb!!! He does. She’s a step behind. And not a moment too soon.. A hellhound EXPLODES into view, as if born out of the jun itself. Tears off a piece of her boot. She grabs a branch. UNLOADS with the handgun. Full clip. Slugs tear into the thing’s head, bounce off the skull, leaving bloody grooves. Don’t improve its looks. Nor do t stop it.
Two more beeline toward Royce and Hanzo.
The monster coils. Vertical leap. Yanks Isabelle off. She falls. Lies there, dazed. Slowly the demon approaches. Teeth dripping saliva. Death incarnate.
Royce grips the machete tighter. Hanzo DRIVES in a fresh clip. Last stand.

Isabelle reaches for her fallen pistol. The beast lets her. Just keeps advancing. We’re close eno to smell its wet carnivore stink, feel its hot breath... She considers. Points the gun at her own head. About to p the trigger...  25.

High pitched, piercing, inhuman, washes over them. The result is immediate and dramatic. The creature slides to a stop, claws digging into dirt. Stares at Isabelle, muscles quivering. And then, just like that, it turns and vanishes into the jungle, as swiftly as it appeared.
The other two facing Royce and Hanzo retreat as well.
Nikolai -- breathing heavy -- his chain gun sweeps the ar seeking targets. There are none.
Stans clutches his bleeding shoulder, locks eyes with Mombasa. Unspoken question.
Any other day, any other place. Pause.
But, bad as you’re, those things whatever they are... are worse.

Isabelle lowers the gun. Her hand shakes. It takes her a supreme effort of will to steady it. SOUND. She draws-- Then Mombasa and Stans. Royce and Hanzo approach from the other side.  26. Finally, Nikolai, dragging a chewed up carcass behind the Drops it. THUD. Everyone’s too drained to speak. Finally,
What the hell are these things?
Mutants maybe. Like after Chernobyl.
They just... left.
(grim) No. The whistle. They were called. They digest, minds reeling. Refusing to comprehend.
What the hell are you saying? Are you saying these... these things are someone's...
Pets. Bloodhounds, maybe. Beat. What comes next is a chilling observation, even mor disturbing than the previous discovery.
There are seven of us. Heads turn. Indeed, they seem to be one short. Namely--
...Help me! They react.
The crew emerge. Stop at the edge of a clearing. Cuchillo, his back toward them, head lolling to the side, sits slumped in the center of a barren swath of dead eart  27.
Hey! HEY!!! You OK?
(without turning) Help me! Isabelle steps forward. Royce’s hand stops her
It’s a trap.

You don’t know that. Royce picks up a rock. Tosses it out into the field. It bounces once. Twice. A SUDDEN blur of steel, as something lashes out from bene the ground. DICES THE STONE TO SMITHEREENS. A chilling, bottomless beat. Like standing on the edge of abyss. And looking down.
(quiet) Wound one man. Make him bleed. Make him suffer. Make him call out for help. Then set a trap and kill those who come. Disgusted with himself, with the world, a confession:
I’ve done this.
...We all have. Pause.
So we leave him, right? Off their looks  28.
I mean, he’s done. There’s nothing we can do. And whoever sent those dog things, he’s out there. Right? For once Stans is right. A confirmation:
We leave him. He turns.
...IT can’t. Royce weighs the moment and her mettle.

Then it’s on you. Angles back into the jungle. One by one, the others pull away, follow in silent agreement. A decision they all hav live with. We stay on Isabelle. Her eyes. Something welling behind t Her entire being is wrecked with silent tension. Until,
Help me! She snaps up the rifle, aims, FIRES, all in one liquid mo
The GUNSHOT washes over them. A few react. Royce doesn’t. Just puts one foot in front of the other.
Isabelle lowers the barrel. Cuchillo’s body is now on its side. She turns to leave.  29.
Help me. She SPINS back toward--

(almost a taunt) Help me. On Isabelle. She’s seen and dealt death on many occasions She’s rarely been afraid. She is now. Hurries after the others. PREDATOR POV: A view from above. Everything in infrared, sharper, more focused than we’ve ever seen. Isabelle rece in the distance. Panning to Cuchillo. A pool of blood glows around the bod becoming more faint, as it cools. And then a RATTLE. Like rats scampering over broken glass This is not your father’s Predator.
Royce in the lead, the rest trailing. Isabelle at the rea They push out of jungle. Ten meters above, a barren, rock ridge line looms. They head toward it.

Slowly, as if clawing his way out of the ground after bei buried alive, Royce appears over the horizon. The others step up next to him. All stare out at the view before them, silent, their expressions unreadable. THEIR POV: Sky as far as the eye can see. Below it, jungl stretches out for miles in every direction.  30. Beyond it, visible in the great distance, are massive, angular chunks of an alien planet, floating in space. A dying, shattered world. Kansas it ain’t.
On Cuchillo, jerking upright. His head swings around, dea eyes staring at us. A blade -- long, sharp, covered in strange runes -- touch the crown of his head, about to scalp him. Off that

The crew are spread out on the ridge, exactly where we le them. Only Stans faces us, looking away from the alien landscap as though by ignoring it, it might somehow go away, rocki slowly back and forth, muttering:

This is not happening. This is not happening. This is not happening. Edwin takes in the strangeness, the grandeur of it all, t slightest hint of a smile creasing his features. Mombasa, a few paces away, Nikolai next to him, both lost thought. Hanzo reloads his gun. Isabelle stares back in the direction of Cuchillo, still living the moment, the kill, the voice. And Royce, alone, apart, an outcast among outcasts.
...What is this place? (loud now, an explosion of emotion fueled by fear) What the hell is this place!?  31. No one answers. Then,
The dogs were flushing us. He is bait. We’re being hunted. A grim beat, as they process their probable fate. Finally
Now what? In response, Royce points to a jungle matted hillock in t distance. In its center, breaking the tree line, something vertical tall. Something... unnatural.
There.

Deep shadows. Dying sun -- burnt orange -- peeks through heavy jungle canopy. Decides to stay out The crew advances, cautious, ready to rumble, ready for anything. Or so they think. CREAKING, soft and steady. Growing stronger as they appro And then they see...

A half dozen creatures, skinned, rotting, all large, all alien, and, judging by their looks, all dangerous, hang b their feet from a long horizontal pole, CREAKING, as they sway in the breeze. On the ground next to the carcasses, a flock of birds -- monstrous, otherwordly, carrion eaters -- feast on offal guts, brains, eyes, organs. There’s plenty of chow for everyone, but they fight anyway, just for the hell of it. Hides are strung over rough wooden frames, curing. A fire smolders, sending up thin wisps of gray smoke.  32. A collection of polished skulls -- many with spinal cords still intact -- is displayed on tree stumps and stakes. These are hard, dangerous men who’ve seen and done more t their share of evil. Still, they stare, transfixed, their faces descending into a state of abject horror and revuls All except one. Edwin’s gaze is akin to that of a man looking up at the ceiling of the Sistine Chapel.
(a whisper) What is this place?

Hell. Edwin’s fingers run along a row of skinning knives, crust with multi-colored blood. Feeling their sharp edges. They pass a large pit, its bottom lost to the shadows. Something big, fast, gunmetal grey SWOOPS by Nikolai, mak the same SCREECHING sound they heard earlier in the jungl They advance further. In the center of the camp, a 150 feet high METALLIC TOTEM POLE, all barbs and blades, covered in arcane hieroglyphi rises out of the earth like an exclamation point. We can see that there is something attached to the other side. Just not what. With our crew. Coming around for a look. Then stopping co Pan off their stunned, speechless faces toward-- Stretched out on the totem is a PREDATOR. CRUCIFIED. It hangs helplessly, head slumped, making no sound, past threshold of pain a man could endure. Florescent green bl glowing in the gathering twilight, covers its many wounds Its helmet is off, armor stripped, shoulder mount smashed dangling loosely off the shoulder. It’s dead. Or close to it.  33. At the base of the monument is a pile of discarded Predat armor, shattered weapons and cleaved skulls. Shock and awe without the bombs.
What. The. Fuck? Mombasa mutters something in his native tongue. No translation required. Hanzo shakes his head, incredulous, unable to process.

(softly) Monsters are real. Isabelle takes a step back. Bumps into Royce. Their eyes meet. In them, he sees something. Fear? Confusion? No. Recognition. The Russian steps forward, chaingun held out. Slowly, carefully he pushes Predator’s head upward with its barre trying to get a better look.
The thing’s bloodshot eyes snap open. Mandibles flare. It ROARS! Nikolai and everyone else jump back.

Let’s get the fuck out of here. Nobody needs to be told twice. They start backing away. The carrion birds EXPLODE into the sky. Guns swivel in their direction. Tense. Sweat beading. Hearts POUNDING. Terror building. They see...
...Nothing. They relax. Mombasa doesn’t. Eyes wide with confusion.  34.

... That wasn’t me. With no warning-- A CLOAKED SPEAR -- visible only thanks to the red chalk outline of Mombasa's blood -- BURSTS out of his chest, dr right through him from behind. His blood paints Stans’s face. Mombasa’s finger depresses the trigger, a dying reflex. H AK BELCHES lead on full auto. The other react, panic FIRE. The fury of their weapons surges in the direction of the attack, riddling the camp and the jungle. Crucified Predator adds its ROAR to the CACOPHONY. There’s nothing to shoot at. Not even the classic Predato shape. Just a faint shimmer. Firing stops. They back away -- more of a herd than a uni

Where is it? Where the fuck is it?! Royce’s eyes pan, looking for movement, motion, anything. Isabelle, rifle up, searching. Nikolai sweeps the chaingun in a wide arc, back and forth Nothing. Slowly Royce’s hand drops to one of the grenades clipped Mombasa’s harness. CLICK. That was the pin. Royce heaves the explosive into space. Rapid throws three more, spacing them around the camp gro at regular intervals. Split second of calm before the storm. Then BOOM! BOOMBOOMBOOM! ! !  35. A cloud of dirt and shrapnel tears through the air ina concussive wave-- Washing over a fast moving form, making it visible for a brief moment. We don’t see much. But we do see this. It. Is. Fucking. Big. Think Predator on steroids. Nikolai sees it, UNLOADS on the thing with the chaingun, ROAR of the weapon matched by his BATTLECRY. PREDATOR POV: Bullets stream toward us in ghastly slow motion. Targeting system tracks each projectile, reads th telemetry, locks on. And then the creature OPENS UP with a chaingun of its own An ERUPTION of flame. The thing is a monster. Makes Nikol BFG look like a child’s toy. Human and Predator rounds COLLIDE mid-air, CLATTER on the ground. Chaingun vs. chaingun. Everyone else retreats, seeking cover and distance. Nikolai stands his ground, still ROARING, barrel white ho and smoking. CLICK, he runs dry. Hauls ass after the others. Predator keeps FIRING. They scatter, as rounds tear by. “Black Hawk Down” time. Isabelle aims at the muzzle flashes, puts a round above t It ricochets off some unseen metal. Bullets arc towards her. Only the grace of God and a dead tree save her. She dives, as branches and bark get PULVERIZED. Pinned down. Royce -- still in motion -- sees it -- shotgun on full au The monster reels from the barrage. A single drop of blood lands on the ground. Royce sees it.  36. And then the thing turns its undivided attention toward h He cuts behind a row of hanging carcasses. Depleted urani slugs turn meat into charnel in his wake. Hands grab Isabelle. Edwin’s. He pulls her up, hauls her toward the tree line.

With Royce, sprinting, as if hell itself was on his heels which, in many ways, it is -- others doing same, as the jungle’s literally SHREDDED behind them, bushes disintegrating, leaves turning to pulp, wood into splinte To Royce’s left, seen only in silhouette and for the brie of moments, we catch a glimpse of an alien ship -- burnis angular steel, lethal, sleek and intimidating. Everyone else is running blind, stumbling, falling, picki themselves up, living from one breath to the next. RAT TAT TAT TAT TAT, the slugs cut through the base of a massive tree trunk like a scythe. Timber!... Its falling shadow eclipses our guys -- the arc of the bullets swings toward them -- crushed or shot, pick your poison -- OH SHIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIII-- The ground before them disappears, and they

Six bodies TUMBLE down a steep slope, an avalanche of flailing arms and legs, SMASHING into stones and roots, weapons CLATTERING away, a long painful way down. With Royce, the world spinning. An outcropping looms. He bounces off it, goes airborne. Which is where the ride gets interesting. He’s falling... falling... something dark and foreboding below, coming up fast.
Royce PLUNGES underwater. Comes up in time to see Isabell and Edwin SPLASH behind him. Stans careens in, SCREAMING. All washed away, fast. Nikolai descends. Disappears. Doesn’t come back up.

HITS bottom. Current pulls him along, raking over rocks. The weight of the chaingun holds him down, drowning him. He thrashes, trying to ditch the thing. An exercise in futility. Lungs screaming for oxygen, getting none. Suddenly a form appears out of the murk.
His knife slices through the chaingun’s harness. Both men shoot for the surface.
Break it, sucking air, only to get swept away toward rapi From the frying pan...
Six heads bob in the river’s fury. Still water ahead. They hit it. Sucked down, out of frame.

Edwin is pulled through some unseen vortex, Isabelle behi him. HER POV: Edwin jerked to the left, disappears. Beat, and sees where. An underwater tunnel, dark and slimy, like a path to hell  38. And she’s tumbling through it, walls rotating around her jagged rocks, sand, plants, fish, all a blur. An underwater rollercoaster -- nightmarish, dizzying, claustrophobic. Abruptly--

She pops back up. Royce. Hanzo. The others. PREDATOR POV: The crew -- glowing thermal shapes in churn black water -- glide toward us. And then, inexplicably-- We are airborne, circle over the prey, then accelerate aw That same SCREECHING sound. That’s because we are seeing through the eyes of--
Segmented wings, barbed alloy, a biomechanical meld of machine and organic tissue. Death from above.

Predator Falcon descends toward the ridge overlooking the river. Wings extend, braking. Settles... on nothing. Wing retract. Just sits there, perched in mid air. Light distorts. The air undulates, shifts. A form SHIMMER into view. We don’t get the money shot. There’1l be time for that la Just a few glimpses, from the back. The rest, mercifully, covered in shadows. One thing for sure... If Predators were frightening, this thing is TERRIFYING. A familiar RATTLE. Meet BLACK SUPER PREDATOR. Twenty yards to his left a SECOND SUPER PREDATOR de-cloak Across the river and fifty yards downstream, a THIRD. This is the hunting party.  39. BLACK SUPER PREDATOR turns toward us. Under a ferocious, almost tribal mask, red eyes, like a p of blood rubies, burn with cold malevolence.

Nikolai drags himself out of the current. Collapses ina shallow pool set by a white sand beach. Hanzo’s next. Edwin. Stans. Heaving. Drenched. Alive. Isabelle’s fingers grasp rocks, find purchase. She pulls herself in. Suddenly a shadow looms over.
Yanks her to her feet. Hand on her throat. Cold fury.
You knew.
I don’t know what you’re--
Yes, you do. In that camp, the way you looked at that thing. You knew. Others approach. Stare. Her eyes search for support. Find none.
What_the hell are they? Beat. A long one.
We don’t have a name for what they are. Just a spook story you hear around the campfire. An urban legend. Alien Bogeyman. Trying to make sense of it herself:
‘87, Guatemala. A rescue team went into the jungle. Spec ops. (MORE)
ISABELLE(cont 'd) High end. Six men plus a CIA liaison. One made it out. In his debrief he said they came in contact with... something not of this world. He gave a detailed description.
(re: her earlier reaction) The thing on the totem.
Yes.
What else?

It could see in infra red. Heat signatures. He used mud to block his. That’s how he was able to beat it. It wore some kind of camouflage that adjusted to ambient light. Made it nearly invisible in our spectrum.
What happened to the survivor?
No one believed him. And then he just... disappeared. Morale of the story:
It hunted and killed his team. One by one. Everybody thinking the same thing:
So what hunted it? They can feel hairs on the backs of their necks standing The sun -- a blood red orb -- sinks below the horizon. Ti wave of shadows washes over, drowning them.  41.
We should get going. Now. Right fucking now.
It wants you to run. Lets them process this.
We wait here. Survive the night. Tomorrow we go back.
Back?! For what?! To save it the walk?
It had a ship.
A ship? A ship?! What are you gonna do with that ship, man? Push the start button? Throw it in gear and drive home? Becoming unglued:
That thing fucked us seven ways to Sunday! You saw what it was doing back there? We’re gonna end up as rugs and ashtrays! We’re dead meat! We don’t have a fucking chance!
(stone cold) It bleeds.
So what?! Look at us, man, we’re bleeding too! Nail on the head.
If it bleeds, we can kill it. Beat.  42.
What makes you think you can fly the ship?
I can’t. But that thing hanging on the pole might. Looks exchanged. The kind that say “you are fucking nuts”

Seen from afar. Still. A cliff wall, peppered with small caves, looms in the distance. Moon and stars illuminate the jungle landscape, muting it hard edges. A SHRIEK in the distance. We don’t even want to guess wha creature could have made it, let alone meet it in person. An insect scurries along. A leathery tongue shoots into frame, grabs it, snaps back like a rubber band inside the mouth of something resembling an oversized tree frog. It chews on the catch. A bird swoops, devours the amphibi whole mid-meal. Survival of the fittest. We travel upward. Toward the tree tops. Different predato Different prey.

A form manifests in the foliage. Hanzo, twenty feet off t ground, rests in the crook formed by trunk and limb. Stans is perched on another tree. Edwin, across from him, scrapes moss off the tree onto a leaf. Waiting for dawn. Isabelle clutches the stock of her rifle. Stares out into alien jungle beyond. Her mind elsewhere. Royce. Eyes closed. Asleep. Or so we think.  43.
Cuchillo. You did the right thing. But you wasted a bullet. She incinerates him with a glare.
I won’t make the same mistake with you. Beat.
What was his name? The man you left behind? She doesn’t answer. He doesn’t expect her to. Then,
What happened to you, Royce? What made you so fucked up? He finally opens his eyes. Every word, every syllable of following bought and paid for in full:
It’s always a jungle. You’re either predator. Or prey. A hanging beat. Neither one looks at the other. Off that,

Isabelle nods off. Snaps back to consciousness. HER POV: A breeze sweeps through the jungle. Branches RIP like the surface of a lake after a stone throw, the effec spreading into the distance. Until it reaches-- One particular branch, 250 yards out. It doesn’t move. She reacts, startled, opens her mouth-- Royce’s hand wraps around it. Shakes his head. Lets go. Isabelle snaps up the rifle. HER POV: Night vision. The branch is already gone.  44. She shakes her head. Royce points. Deep in jungle, the faintest sense of motion. She tracks it. HER POV: A glimmer. There one moment, gone the next. CLICK, she drops the safety. Others hear it, react, tensi
Something fast and agile cuts into frame, arcing left. Circling our guys.

In the trees, everyone’s alert, looking out in different directions, waiting for an attack. A bug lands on Stans’s neck. He crushes it, eyes never leaving the jungle. Isabelle. Glued to the scope. A whisper
Why isn’t it coming?

...It’s waiting. She glances at him. Shakes her head. She doesn’t have a s And they can’t sit here forever. Beat. Slowly Royce puts down his weapon. Ammo. Side arm. Lighte the load. Isabelle. Royce. Reading one another
Don’t miss.

On Royce -- running. Fifty yards to his left, a blur, moving parallel, matchin pace. Royce keeps running, leaping logs, ducking low branches. ISABELLE’S POV: Royce, sprinting. Rapid shifts to his pursuer. Now forty yards out and closing. Two trains ona collision course. Back to Royce. He angles left. The hunter adjusts accordingly. ISABELLE’S POV: Its form -- still largely unseen -- strob through the bushes. Too fast to draw a bead on. Royce -- he can hear it approaching -- still, he never lo back, never skips a beat -- just hauls ass. Eight yards out... Six... Isabelle’s finger tenses on the trigger HER POV: Four yards... Two... Royce -- the creature almost upon him. Talons -- long, black, jagged -- SLASH! BANG! Thing’s blown off to the side and out of frame. Royce drops to the ground, exhausted. Isabelle lowers the rifle, her expression unreadable.
Royce stands over the slain monster, doubled over, suckin wind. The others approach.
Is it dead? Royce manages a nod.  46.

When why the fuck aren’t you smiling?! Royce motions over his shoulder toward the body. We finally get a good look The creature resembles a stick bug, multi-jointed limbs protruding from its exoskeleton, carapace covered in shar bone blades. Definitely not a Predator. More importantly, A harness stretches over its chest. In the center, a brok altimeter.
(fuck me) ...It’s one of us. Isabelle approaches.
Good shot, anyway. She ignores him. Checks the tree trunk next to the corpse A ragged hole in it. The confirmation she needed.
I missed.
They react -- sitting ducks -- can practically feel anoth incoming round screaming toward them... Instead, a low, quiet rasp:
Over here. They spin toward it. Nothing. Behind them now:

Over here.  47. Everyone, save Royce, reflexively swings that way. Royce -- fool me once -- stays put, eyes panning slowly.. The tip of a burnished barrel brushes his ear. He turns. Finds himself facing the business end of a long rifle. Only alien and much more badass. At its terminus, jungle. And two eyes.
What are you?

Fucked. How about you? Beat. The barrel pulls away. Jungle seems to shift. A camouflaged form, composed of le and vines, steps forward. The ultimate Ghillie suit. The that hunters wear to blend into their surroundings. Its hood is pulled back to reveal-- NOLAND. 60’s. Hard open face, battered by elements and ag Scars. Burn marks. It’s not the years, it’s the mileage.
Alive. Takes in our crew. Doesn’t like what he sees. His voice h the cadence of a man who hasn't used it in a very long ti
And you're sloppy. I've been hearing you for six hours. Smelling you for eight. And if I can, so can they. (beat) It’s going to rain soon. Starts to walk away.
Wait. Off his look,  48.
Who are you? The sound of his own name seems almost unfamiliar to him:
My name is... Noland. He strides back into the jungle. Our crew trade glances. Wisely decide to follow.

High stone walls loom. Noland heads for them, moving with practiced precision of a seasoned hunter. An odd sight ahead stops them in their tracks. Three Predator skeletons -- ancient, bones bleached, rib cages pulverized, skulls shattered -- lie on the ground. The forth is fused with a Super Predator skeleton, blades not even a speck of rust, even after all these centuries driven into one another, locked in an eternal struggle. They take in the eerie tableau, staggered by it. Noland just brushes past it. He’s seen it all before. THUNDER CLAPS in the distance. Plants begin to close up. Bulbs retract, as thick, fibrou leaves wrap around them protectively. Soon we’1ll know wh Noland picks up the pace. To our crew:
Hurry. Drops start to fall. Sizzle on the skeletons. One hits Stans’s shoulder, burns through fabric. He YELPS

What the fuck?! Make that acid rain. Figures.  49. Dead end ahead. Noland marches toward it, undeterred. Rou an outcropping. Pulls back a heavy camouflage net. Cave entrance behind it. He disappears inside. Our heroes trail. All save-- Edwin. Frozen. Something in his expression we haven’t see since we’ve met him. Terror.
I have... an issue... with small spaces.

Deal with it. Edwin tries. Can’t. Shaking, on the verge of hyperventilating -- his creepy c veneer cracking like ice -- at the moment he’s nothing bu stranger in a strange land, stranded, scared, pathetic. More drops fall. The ground smolders. If Edwin stays outs he’s toast. Isabelle takes pity. Steps back out.
Look at me. Look at me. He does. Deer in the headlights.
We’re going to do this together Take my hand. Keep moving. One foot in front of the other. Slowly and with supreme effort, Edwin complies.
Good. You’re doing good. They enter--
Nikolai pulls a Claymore from his pack. Plants it, about string a trip wire.  50.

Don’t. They’re smart. Too smart for that. He moves off into darkness. Clearly knows every inch of t place. The passage continues ahead, curving to the left. Noland pushes up against a wall. A hatch opens up.

Isabelle and Edwin are last to arrive. Noland pulls a hea trap door closed behind them, secures it with alloy rods. Turns up a dial on some strange device. Light washes over illuminating-- The space is large and spartan. Thee hatch. A cot next to Makeshift table and bench. Hard living. Everywhere, bits and pieces of gear, some man made, most alien. A scavenger's den. Noland puts down the rifle. As he peels off his Ghillie s
They drop you in? Royce nods.
Hell of a rush, huh? An armored plate beneath it. Think alien Kevlar. Stans ey it, greedy, envious. KNOCKS on it, liking the sound.
Where did you get that?
Off the guy who didn’t need it anymore. Don’t touch my stuff. Another suit under the plate, this one made out of the hi of some creature. Off their looks,
Blocks the body heat. Can’t hunt what you can’t see.  51.
How long have you been here? Noland motions to a wall. Thousands of lines carved into stone. Thousands of days.
Jesus...
Don’t see much of him around here. We win the war?
Iraq?
Vietnam. Nikolai shakes his head.
Figured we wouldn't. Victory's in the mind. We lost before we even went in.
How did you survive this long?
Being smart. Keeping my head down. Salvaging what I can, when I can from whatever I can. Making sure they don’t know where I am. You want food?
I could eat. Noland nods to an earthen bowl. Edwin peeks inside. Loose his appetite very quickly.
I'd tell you it tastes like chicken. Except I don't remember what chicken tastes like. But you can live on it.  All ears. 52.
What is this place?
Far as I can tell, a game preserve. And you and I are the game.
They stock it.
That's right. You're lucky. Most humans don’t make it this far.
So all this is just for sport?
I didn't say that.

Every year they bring in the fresh meat. Shit you wouldn’t even believe. They hunt ‘em. Kill ‘em. But every so often one of us kills one of them. That’s when they get real interested. Slice the poor son of a bitch up. See what makes him tick. Next season, when they are back, maybe their weapons have changed, or maybe their armor. Maybe even them. They trade glances.
How do we stop them?
You don't.
They've got to have a weakness.
Some ones we got. ‘cept what kills us just hurts them. (MORE)
NOLAND(cont'd) (shakes his head) I’m going to bed. No loud noises. They're out there.
How do you know?
(matter of fact) Because they're always out there.

Time's passed. Lights are low. Noland's asleep on his cot The crew is arrayed around the cave. Nowhere to go. Nothi to do. Just time to kill. And ponder Hanzo’s eyes take in a pile of weapons in the corner. Som we recognize -- a pump action ten gauge, a katana, a CAR- a flare gun, Dirty Harry’s Magnum. Some whose origins we only imagine. Hanzo picks up the katana. Studies it with reverence. Pul the blade half way out of the scabbard. His eyes are reflected in the steel.
This is old. Very old. They react, both to the statement and the fact that he’s finally broken his silence.
They’ve been doing this for a long time.
You speak English.
Yes.
So why didn’t you say something? Hanzo lifts up his diminished hand.  54.
(indicating the missing fingers) Because I talked too much. Nikolai laughs. Not a sound you hear often in this place. Stans chuckles as well. To Edwin:
So what’s your story, white bread?
I don’t have one.
Everybody’s got a story.
I sell life insurance.
Yeah? How about you write mea policy? He chuckles. Edwin doesn’t.
I’m afraid that would be a poor investment.
Why is that?
(same flat monotone) Because we’re all going to die. Stans’s smile fades. Isabelle and Royce, in the far corner, apart from the res
He's right.
Not me. I’m going home.
What’s that?  55.
Earth.
Anyone waiting for you there? Anyone who was sad to see you go in the first place? Anyone at all? He doesn’t respond. She doesn’t expect him. A reversal.
Do you know what I was doing when I was taken? The things I have done? Do you have any idea?
You did what you had to do.

I used to believe that. I used to believe a lot of things. (beat) The trouble with the end justifying the means is that sometimes you get to the end and wonder if it was worth it. And what it was all for. Eyes full of pain.
You said we were chosen. I asked for what. I should have asked why. Midnight of the soul:
It’s because we are predators Royce. Just like them. And going home isn’t going to change that. Beat. Hollow. Crushing. It hangs there. Until,
Where’s Noland? Heads turn to the cot. Empty. Royce moves to the hatch, tries to pull it open. No dice, it’s sealed from the other side.  56.
Noland! NOLAND! No response.
What the hell is he doing?
Collecting. Off their reactions,

He's a scavenger. What he can, when he can, from whatever he can. Or whomever. He wants what we have. As a confirmation, smoke -- grey-green and thick -- begin pour in through holes in the floor. FUBAR. They react. Some try to cover their mouths. Others attemp plug the vents. Both plans appear futile. Royce -- spur of the movement -- JACKS in a green shell i his shotgun.
Get down.
What are you--? Royce levels the weapon toward the far wall.
Now! Everyone dives for cover. BOOOM! That was a Frag-12 round. Effectively turning the shotgun into a rocket launcher.
Muffled concussion. A few rocks slide. Otherwise it’s qui  57.
SUPER PREDATOR POV: Keying in on falling rocks. Tracking back to the source. Detecting a hot spot on the cliff fac radiating from the inside.
Our guys pick themselves up, ears ringing, dust and debri covering their bodies.
What the fuck was that?
Calling in the cavalry.
Noland stands outside, stoking a fire, smoke wafting upwa into his cave. Hears. Knows.
(under his breath) You crazy fucker. Books for the exit. Too late. Framed at the mouth of the cave, the outline of a monster Noland takes a step back... and raises his hands. Calmly:
I'm unarmed. BLAM, a plasma round PLASTERS him all over the wall. The Super moves past the charbroiled corpse.

Royce and the others crouch by the hatch. Smoke still billows, then shifts, as something approaches from the ot side.  58. Wait for it... Wait for it... WHAM, WHAM, WHAM, the Super RAMS the door. Hatch BUCKLES inward. Rivets POP. The thing barely hangs in its hinges. They back away, guns trained on the entrance. And then the attack ceases, as abruptly as it began. They trade glances.
We stay here, we die. We run, we die.
You talk too much. He grabs a flare gun. Sticks it into the breach. Pulls th trigger.

WHOOSH, the projectile steaks down the passage. SUPER’S POV: A glowing globe heads toward us, its heat accentuated by the infra red. EXPLODES. A mini supernova. Super’s momentarily blind. Reflexively grabs its eyes. Te second window. All the time our heroes need. They dash past.
And we’re running again. Twisting and turning corridors o jagged rock, illuminated only by the tactical flashlight mounted on Royce’s shotgun.
SUPER PREDATOR POV: Filters kick in to compensate. Vision returns. It chases after our crew.  59.

With the crew, sprinting like their lives depend on speed the moment, they do. FOOTFALLS behind them. Royce and Nikolai, at the rear, lay cover fire. Muzzles flash. Slugs spark and ricochet off stone. They run some more. Spread out. Tighten up. Always in mot Stop and you die. Walls glisten with condensation. Close in. So does the demon behind them. Ahead, the passage drops down into darkness. They keep going, blind, slipping down the slime covered incline, into--

A cathedral of stone. Something black and alive undulates the ceiling like some enormous organism. No cover. No exit. End of the line. They cast about, frantic, searching for options. Finding none. The sound of water SLOSHING in the distance, drawing near Guns swing in its direction.

Can’t say it’s been a pleasure. They gets ready. Closer... Closer... Inside the cave. Which is when Royce rotates his weapon, FIRES! Not at the Super. At the ceiling. We might have a split second to ponder what he has against it. Maybe not. Cause  60. Hundreds, nay, thousands of bats EXPLODE from it in all directions. A screeching maelstrom of motion and wings CRASHES over the Super, veering around it, framing its outline, making it visible once again. SUPER PREDATOR POV: A CACOPHONY of high pitched SQUEALS. practically RIPS APART its ear drums. Targeting system go berserk, locking in on everything and nothing. Super HOWLS in pain, claws at its skull, FIRES blindly. In a word, pandemonium. Amidst all this Royce moves, low and fast, others trailin Some of the bats escape upward. We track their flight pat A natural chimney rises up at a 45 degree angle, previous obscured by the nesting bats. A way out. They rush toward Super recovers. Targets our crew. BAM! Plasma round SCORCHES Nikolai, sends him sprawling. Isabelle spins toward him. Nikolai -- on the ground, hurt bad -- eye contact.
(to Isabelle) Come on! Nikolai simply shakes his head. Then looks away. Royce grabs her. She doesn’t move. A thousand miles away.
Come on, damn it! She snaps back to reality. Shoves Royce aside.

Don’t. Fucking. Touch me. Resumes running. Royce follows. Into the chimney they go. Nikolai remains. Props himself up against the wall. Clutc his chest. Waits... Super de-cloaks into view.  61. Massive. Armored. Unblinking ruby red eyes burn under a ghoulish death mask. A walking nightmare. SNAP, its wrist blade extend, gleaming in low light. Wolverine would be jealous. Drives them into Nikolai’s mid-section. Lifts the big man the ground like a rag doll.
Super studies Nikolai like a bug under a microscope. Want waiting for him to cry out. To beg. But all it gets is:

(subtitled Russian) You... are... one.. ugly... mother fucker. CLICK. Super’s eyes snap down to Nikolai’s chest. Two Claymores. And he just pulled the safeties. Nikolai starts to laugh -- eerily similar to Billy’s icon laugh in the original.

With out guys, shimming upward, as-- World seems to convulse. Rocks shift. Chunks dislodge, fa Royce looks down. HIS POV: Fireball blossoms from below, moving toward them with a concussive ROAR. He barely has time to pull himself over an outcropping an press into a crevice before-- Flame WASHES OVER him -- a flash of fury, heading for the surface. And then it’s gone. Looking up, Royce sees the others. Smoldering. Singed. Bu alive.  62. They keep climbing. We rise above them, through the chimn over the exit, as-- Something STREAKS past the camera. A familiar SCREECH.
Royce reaches the surface. Collapses. A barren plateau stretches out like an island of stone, surrounded by jungle on all sides. Almost in disbelief:
We... killed it. (realization dawning) We fucking killed it!!! He peers down the chute. Practically dancing a jig:

Fuck you, ET! How do you like us now, motherfucker?! Huh?! Huh?! Hunt this! He grabs his package. BOOM! Plasma caster NAILS Stans in the back, blowing him of frame. Revealing-- Black Super Predator. Finally unveiled in his full glory. Heavy jet black armor -- a hellish mix of medieval knight samurai -- envelops its hulking frame like the Grim Reape shroud. Desiccated remains of its victims hang around its neck an belt. A triple headed plasma caster rests on its mount. Cruelly curved blades at the elbows. Spikes on shoulders, knees a heels. Even its dreadlocks are weapons, each strand endin with a razor-sharp tip weaved into the hair. That same chilling RATTLE again. Laser sight extends, painting Royce’s forehead.  63. On Royce. Resigned. Ready. No sign of fear. BLACK’S POV: Royce, in infrared. A mass of color. Keying on his beating heart. Measuring its steady rate. ROYCE’S POV: Nothing so fancy. Taking in the monstrosity before him. Giving it nothing. An eye fuck. Game over in 3-2- WHAM, Stans -- not quite as dead as we figured -- LEAPS o from behind. PLUNGES his shiv into the thing’s neck. Black’s turn to suffer. Round intended for Royce goes wil Stans -- his back a scorched, bloody mess, Noland’s alien Kevlar exposed under the shredded fabric of his prison jumpsuit -- a hole through the armored plate, but it boug him the next few precious seconds of life -- hangs on to Black like a pitbull, stabbing, punching, slashing, ROARI We finally see why he was chosen. He’s a fucking animal.

(to the others) Go! GO!!! They run for it. Black -- its own ROAR drowns Stans’s -- DRIVES a bladed e into his side, WHAM, WHAM. Its plasma caster SWIVELS, tracking the fugitives. Stans -- bleeding, dying, fuck you, he eats that for breakfast -- grabs the shoulder mount, twists it the othe way, pointing the barrel toward the fucker’s head. Black -- can’t fire without blowing its own brains -- re- focuses his attention on Stans. WHAM! WHAM! WHAM! Finally Stans expires, still clinging on to his opponent even in death.
What’s left of our crew -- Royce, Isabelle, Hanzo, Edwin keep moving.  64.

Stans’s body HITS the ground. Black Super Predator looms over. Levels its heavy gaze on jungle. Another Super SHIMMERS into view alongside him. Locks in the same direction. Black BELLOWS! It’s the cry of a hunter. Stirring fear in the heart of i prey. And then the two creatures move, fast, efficient strides heading after their prey, fading to invisibility.

The screen is a microcosm of leaf, crystal drops of precipitation refracting the moonlight, stone and emerald green moss. We hear the JUNGLE. Some distant BIRDS. HUM o insects. The whisper of the WIND. Royce -- a flash -- streaks into frame. Disturbing no lea breaking no branches, making no sound. Isabelle and Edwin behind him, Hanzo trailing.
Same spot. Distant RUSTLING. It gets closer and louder. We don’t see Black Super Predator. We can only feel its passage by the vibration of the drops. As they fall--
A forty yard sheet of rocks. Royce leaps onto it, keeps running.

Black Super Predator SHIMMERS into view. Scans the area w the clinical detachment of a crime scene forensic. Shifts gaze toward the ground.  65. BLACK SUPER PREDATOR’S POV: Tracks end at the stretch of rock. Exponential magnification in rapid snaps. Times 4. 16. 32. Depressions in the stone. Deviations in topograph “Enemy Of The State” time. But no good track. Which is exactly what Royce intended. Undeterred, Black CYCLES through different vision modes, a camera changing lenses. Ultraviolet. Terahertz. Gamma. Finally settles on-- Chemical sensor. Our heroes’ scent still lingers in the a in the form of their distorted silhouettes. It’s like loo back in time and seeing a pheromone imprint left by the person who occupied the space minutes ago. Black follows it, fading back to invisibility, certain as death and taxes. We understand the game being played. A duel of hunters. Technology against survival skills. Terminator vs. Rambo.
The totem rises over the jungle canopy in the distance.

Royce emerges out of bushes. Swamp to the left. Solid gro to the right. Others stumble behind. Sucking air. Suffering the effects the run. Royce puts his ear to the ground. The thing might be invisible. But it’s not immaterial. And it is heavy. He can sense their pursuer approaching in the distance. Into the swamp they go. Brackish, foul smelling water ris up to meet them.

BLACK’S POV: Moving. The pheromone trail lies before us l an illuminated path. Then... nothing. It just gets abrupt erased mid-air, overwhelmed by the stench of the swamp.  66. Black RATTLES in frustration. ITS POV cycles back to infrared. Revealing the second Super, standing a few feet away, invisible in the previous spectrum. A look between them. Something passes. Second Super cuts into the swamp. Black skirts around it, trying to outflank our guys. A vi
Royce and the others push through knee deep water, going fumes and desperation.

SECOND SUPER’S POV: Moving, stopping. Panning around. Cyc modes. Nothing. As any hunter knows, it’s impossible to track over water. Or is it?.... MACRO CLOSE on the surface of the swamp. Detecting INFINITESIMAL RIPPLES, reverberating from our heroes’ fad footsteps. Calculating the distance from the source. And then we are moving again.
With our crew, running, their feet SLASHING rhythmically against the water.
In Super’s POV, following their wake.
Royce, still on the move, grabs a passing tree limb.

Splash! Splash! The Super, seen only via the afore-mentio effect, rushes through the same spot, glued to the trail. Which is why it doesn’t see the vine stretched an inch ab the bottom. An improvised trip wire. Snags it-- WHAM, the tree limb uncoils, WHIPLASHES it into next week SPLASH!!! Something heavy tumbles into the swamp. Beat. The creature climbs back on its feet, blue sparks coursing around its flickering form. Cloak is on the frit Then gives out completely. Super PUSHES control panel buttons on its gauntlet. No jo Tries the vision modes. Same. And then it HISSES like a pissed off cat.
Royce climbs out onto a muddy embankment, others in tow. Ten yards out, an ocean of tall grass. Savannah. They hea for it.
Everyone collapses, exhausted beyond words. For a while t only sounds we hear are the wind and their ragged breathi Then,
...They’re running us down.
The more they chase us, the weaker we get.
Persistence hunting. Driving us to exhaustion. Break’s over.  68.

Star splattered sky. Grass sways in the breeze. Four silhouettes, seen from afar, move through it. One STOPS. Royce glances back. Hanzo stands in the center of the clearing. Tired of runn Looks at the survivors. A simple nod. All they can do is keep going. Slowly, meticulously Hanzo removes his shirt. Folds it neatly. Lays down on the ground. Just like the shoes. The body beneath covered in irezumi. Full body Yakuza tattoos. Dragon. Tiger. Images of violence made somehow beautiful through art. He unsheathes the katana. Holds it loosely, blade pointed downward, Takakura Ken style. He waits. Over his shoulder, as Second Super approaches. Targeting beam triangulates Hanzo’s face. Then drops down toward the tattoos. SUPER’S POV: Data, first on the man -- vital organs musculoskeletal structure, nervous system -- then on the blade -- measurements, chemical composition -- scrolls. Hanzo waits. The beam disappears. Slowly the Super unstraps its caster. It THUDS on the gro Walks towards Hanzo, picking up pace, as he goes. SNAP. SNAP. Twin WRIST BLADES -- acid etched alien steel covered by glyphs and kill notches -- extend. Two master swordsmen from different sides of the galaxy.  69. Super charges. A freight train. Hanzo stands his ground. IMPACT. Steel on steel. Sparks fly. A flurry of moves -- slashes, stabs, blocks and counterattacks -- too dazzling comprehend -- a dance of death, a duel of equals. They disengage. Circle. Looking for openings. Suddenly lunge. CLASH. Swords LOCK, GRIND along each othe The eyes of their owners are linked as well. Slivers of metal SHEER. A shower of sparks. Super flexes its massive arms, driving Hanzo back. SLASH! A line of red wells across Hanzo’s shoulder. Super flicks off its opponent’s blood. Hanzo nods. Switches his stance. High guard. Super considers. His own blade hangs low. Hanzo adjusts his grip. Shifts his balance. A coiled spri SUPER’S POV: Computer calculates Hanzo’s weight dispersal Muscle tension. Predicting where he’s going to strike nex They charge toward one another. A BLUR of steel, as they pass. SWISH! SLASH! Then stop. Beat. We can’t tell who got whom. Until... Super gurgles black blood. Slides apart, split from shoul to thigh. Hanzo DRIVES his sword into the ground. An echo of Kurosa His hand on the hilt. Blood flows freely down the wrist. He looks up at the sky. Collapses. A beautiful death.  70.

Royce cuts between leafy plants, pushes into a small clearing. Three miles out, the totem. Nearing home stretc A form glides into view. Predator Falcon. That same SCREECHING sound again. Noting Royce’s reaction:
It’s just a bird, is it?

No, it’s not. The master can’t be far behind. Royce casts about, searching for an out. Cover is sparse. They stay on the ground, they’re dead. His gaze travels upward, toward the jungle canopy. Isabel tracks it. Reacts. Shit. And she thought running was bad.
Got a better idea? She doesn’t. Edwin pales a bit.
Let me guess. Heights. He nods. Then, tapping into some hidden reservoir, a hint steel beneath his meek exterior:

I know. Deal with it. They begin to climb, using branches, vines, outcroppings anything they can for purchase. The Falcon continues to circle. We zero in on its eye. Then PULL BACK. Except we’re now--
On the eye of its master. Bird’s POV reflected in the pup Black can see what the Falcon sees. A biomechanical link.  71.
With our guys, no safety lines, pushing themselves upward fighting for every inch, and now it’s a race, cause--
BLACK’S POV: Knows exactly where they are, and he’s hauli ass!
Climbing. The canopy looms above. A shield of green. We d toward it, slowly but surely.
BLACK’S POV: Going flat out at punishing pace, strong, effortless, a machine.
At last they reach the top. Royce looks down. Bushes RIPPLE, as if a small tornado was passing through them. Closing rapidly on their position. Isabelle, just below, reacts to his expression.
Do I want to know?
No. You want to run.

That they do. A mad dash through an intricate latticework of tree limbs thick and intertwined they form a kind of hidden, treache catwalk, broken up by gaps and crevices. A vertigo-induci experience. As they pass, we descend through the foliage, streak towa the ground below toward--  72.
Black -- a shimmer -- fifty feet down and a hundred yards behind -- relentless, gaining. ITS POV: Leaves obscure the view of the prey. No matter
The Falcon SWOOPS from above, and we’re now in its POV, w our guys again, sprinting, struggling forward, unaware th

Black’s plasma caster WHIRS into motion. BLACK’S POV: Aiming through the bird’s eyes. Matching the movements, anticipating where they are going to be in the split second it’1l take the rounds to reach their marks.
The Falcon -- ahead of the quarry -- keeps a constant loc
Black Super -- has them dead to rights -- about to fire,
BAM, BAM, BAM! Royce OPENS UP on the Falcon. It’s forced to evade. Tracer rounds STREAK by.
BOOM! Black’s blast -- targeting lock disengaged -- misse blowing chunks out of a tree.  73.

The bird dips, trying to recover, coming around for anoth pass. Royce keeps pouring rounds at it. Keeps missing. It’s ducking, weaving, constantly changing altitude, impossible to hit. BOOM! Another blast ERUPTS through the canopy, closer now The concussion knocks Royce back. He loses the shotgun. It plummets below. FALCON’S POV: target lock re-acquired.
Falcon -- a mid-air explosion of feathers and metal -- corkscrews into a tree like a shot down Messerschmitt. Bullseye. Isabelle lowers the smoking barrel.
BLACK’S POV: The link severed. Everything goes black. BEL in pain and rage!
Royce -- a simple nod to Isabelle -- keeps moving.
BLACK’S POV: Vision returning slowly. Panning across the canopy. No sign of the prey. And then it really RATTLES!  74.
Royce drops into frame, descending from the tree. Isabell next. Then Edwin. He takes two steps and--
Edwin SCREAMS. A barbed vice -- an alien bear trap -- is locked onto his ankle, bronze alloy stained red. Isabelle rushes toward him. Drops to her knees. Strains t pull the jaws open. Can’t.
Help me! Royce doesn’t move. She glares. Continues to struggle. Eventually they give j enough for Edwin to pull his leg free. He collapses. She examines the wound. Edwin winces.
Hurts?
Like hell.
Good. Means there’s still blood flowing. Another quarter of an inch, and it would have hit your femoral artery.
Guess it’s my lucky day.
It isn’t. He doesn’t even look at the wound. He doesn’t have to.  75.
That trap wasn’t meant to kill. Just to maim. Cold hard truth. Both barrels of it:
Leave him.
Hang on just a fucking second!
(to Edwin) No offence. But you’re dead weight.
I can still walk!

Not for long. You’1l get winded quickly. You’1l say you don’t need any help. But sooner or later you’11 start lagging behind. Eventually you won’t be able to continue on your own. We’1l feel bad. We’1ll carry you. And then you’11 drag us down with you. Beat. Both know he’s right Royce takes out his handgun. Ejects the clip. Leaving--
One round in the pipe. That’s all you need. He tosses the pistol to Edwin. Isabelle explodes, the total tonnage of everything she’s through in the last 36 hours unleashing like a broken dam
We can’t do this! This isn’t right! This isn’t fucking right! He’s one of us! Royce’s calm matches her fury.  76.
Don’t you get it? This is a trick. Do you think it would stop for one of its own? It wants your compassion. Your pity. To feel something for this man. To be human. Beat.
Then I guess I am. What are you?
(an echo of Noland’s line) Alive. Brass tacks:
...I/m not dying for him. You want to carry him, it’s on you. Starts walking away.
Royce! He slows. Turns. Meaning every word:
You don’t belong here with us. You belong back there. With them. Royce processes this. And then he’s gone, consumed by jungle. Beat.
You should have gone with him.
(simply) I know. She grabs Edwin’s hand, pulls him to his feet
Something knocks them out of frame.
They lying on the ground, wrapped in it like a cocoon. THEIR POV: Black materializes. Looms over. Off that

Moving through it. Shell casings litter the ground. Trees pocked with bullet holes. Earth marred by grenade blasts. A battle zone. Three remaining Predator hunting dogs lunge at the bars o their cages, foaming at the mouth, choking on BARK like vomit, trying to get at someone just beyond their reach. Predator still hangs on the totem. Snaps back to consciousness. PREDATOR POV: Royce standing before him. Close. Too close Picks up an axe from a pile of discarded Predator weapons the thing’s feet. Feels its weight in his hand. Beat.
You understand me? Crucified Predator focuses on him with bloodshot eyes.

I want out. Off world. There’s a ship here. Can you fly it? Crucified Predator studies Royce for a long beat. Then, a nod. Slowly Royce raises the blade... THWACK! He cuts the creature’s bond. THWACK! THWACK! THWA Predator falls to the ground. Moment of truth.  78. Predator rises to his feet. Massive. Imposing, even despi his injuries. Or perhaps because of them. Royce stares at him, tensing, ready to fight and die. And then the thing ROARS! It is a cry ripped from the depths of its soul. Fierce. Primitive. Timeless.

Isabelle and Edwin are DRAGGED along the jungle floor Captives. The ROAR washes over them. Birds SCREECH. Animals HOWL. I as if the jungle itself is reacting to the creature’s cal Black’s head snaps toward the sound.

The space is dark and dormant as a crypt. Bulkheads. Machinery. Grates. Spartan. Efficient. Lived in. CLOSE ON a Lexan panel. A gauntlet covered Predator hand glides along Lights FLICKER on. A WHIR emanates from somewhere deep in the ship’s core. Grows stronger. Holographic display materializes. Star charts cycle through. Finally settling on-- A familiar blue planet. It reflects in Royce’s eyes. Another panel flashes, red, insistent. A second hologram manifests. Ground proximity sensors. On three forms -- one massive, two smaller, entwined -- approaching. Predator hand reaches down. Picks up the original, old sc plasma caster resting on the floor. Lowers it onto his shoulder mount.  79. Caster CLICKS into place. SWIVELS. GRINDS to a halt. Predator SLAMS his shoulder against a bulkhead. Caster swivels again, this time clean, even. Malfunction fixed. Payback time. Predator -- fully armed, fully armored, a warrior restore his former glory -- pushes out toward the exit. Royce looks after. Predator exits the ship, hitting a panel on his way out. The hell that is this planet is erased from view, as the bulkhead SEALS SHUT, leaving Royce very much alone.
Isabelle and Edwin lie next to the pit, still wrapped in net. Black’s foot pushes them in. We fall with them into--

They land. HARD. Isabelle cranes her neck, looks up. The walls of the pit tower above her like a silent scream Marked by claws, talons and finger tracks of all shapes a sizes -- a rainbow spatter of dried blood -- left by the pairs of frenzied limbs of those came before her. The earth RUMBLES. Bits of rock and dirt tumble down.

A few skulls RATTLE. Black’s eyes snap toward them. Then to the totem. Predator’s gone, bonds cut Black swings around in the direction of his ship...  80. And DIVES, as a plasma bolt WHIPS by. Instantly fades to invisibility, triple targeting beams searching for the shooter. Movement. Black UNLOADS, tearing the jungle to pieces. Return fire scorches ground, Black’s form bracketed by debris. Clearly his opponent can see through the cloak. Black reacts, firing fast, running faster. Above him, Predator -- a blur -- leaps from tree to tree, BLASTING back. Rounds COLLIDE, EXPLODING mid air. A fireworks show in th dim pre-dusk light. With Black, still in motion, as a form CATAPULTS out of t jungle toward him on an intercept course.
Predator vs. Super Predator. Original vs. Upgrade. Clash the fucking titans. We’re tight, close quarters, hand to hand. Think snarling pitbulls rolling along, ripping each other apart.
Isabelle moves one arm. Manages to pull a knife out of he boot. Starts to saw through the mesh. Metal frays. Sounds of the fight above.
Engines spool up. Everything vibrates. Autopilot begins t countdown. Royce straps himself in. Time to go home.

Two forms BASH each other against cages. Predator and Sup Predator sized dents. Cloaks fry.  81. Gauntlets SMASH into one another. Armored fist against armored fist. Blood SPATTERS. Predator gets tossed against an empty cage. Steel BUCKLES Dogs tear at the bars, trying to get at him. Black’s chaingun whip-draws itself -- locks onto-- Predator, as he leaps, pushing the weapon upward. It fires aimlessly, swiss cheesing the sky. Predator SLICES its barrels off with his wrist blades. White hot metal falls.
SNAP, a strand of alloy mesh breaks. Isabelle starts sawi through another. The walls are shaking, both with the fury of the battle a and the rising ROAR of the engines.
Tight on Royce. Last man standing. He’s alive. He made it. Nothing to do now but sit back an enjoy the ride. But victory has a hollow taste...
Predator -- Black -- wrist blades locked. A contest of strength, neither one willing to back down. WHAM, Black delivers a vicious HEADBUTT that craters the other guy’s helmet.
The hole is now big enough to wiggle out. Metal tears at Isabelle’s skin, as she pulls herself free. Helps Edwin out. He nods, grateful.  82.
On Royce. His eyes. He can walk away. He should. He must.

Predator staggers. Black DRIVES the wrist blades into his back, puncturing the skin at the base of the vertebrae. Wraps its hand around it. Pulls with otherworldly strengt RIPS out Predator’s spinal column. It’s over. Black -- covered in blood, green and black -- studies his slain opponent. Discards the grizzly object
Boosters FIRE, incinerating the ground below. Liftoff.
Black’s head snaps toward the ship in ample time to see i launch into space. Down force kicks up leaves, knocks ove skulls. One helluva exit. Black’s eyes track the ascent. Twin points of pure hatred
